column4: I currently have my entire HDD partitioned to sda1, can gparted peel off a chunk so that I can use it for windows 7?
without destroying all the data
absolutely, i'd run your backup just incase but yes gparted can resize just fine
I thought so too, but when I have my /dev/sda1 selected, resize/move never lights up
gksudo gparted
ahhQ!
not much at all
vmware performs better than vbix on dual core cpus
but it's so bloated and difficult to setup
ive found it painless
maybe i had bad documentation, but it was not a good time =(
its no way as easy as vbox though
lol i had netbook remix, xp and win7 up and running in 20 minutes on VB
well minus the installation time.
whats it do?
theres bios linux which is quite risky but puts the kernel and some modules in bios so your system boots faster
never heard of that
sounds like its very specific to the hardware
theres magnetic ram (i think its called that) coming soon which will act like an SSD on the mobo so will be really fast for boots and access
im looking forward to it, i saw expressgate in action today, preboot OS, was sexy
just dont turn off the pc ;)
